p: Although kratom is reported to be used as a safe substitute to opioids in self-managing pain, dependence and withdrawal ( 23â€“ 25), it is not free from adverse effects and risks. Kratom dependence has been reported if the product is used in larger quantity over a prolonged period, and negative effects such as sleep problems, depressed mood, diarrhea, and flu-like symptoms including muscle and joint pain can develop with sudden withdrawal ( 27). Fatalities involving kratom are rare and, autopsy findings indicate that in such instances kratom is concurrently used with illicit substances or anti-depressants, and not kratom per se, or the user had an underlying health condition ( 28, 29). So far, there have been no reports specifically on fatal kratom overdose incidences ( 30).
